summary: This is an email from a Financial Program Specialist at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding procurement issues (purchase orders for fiber cable and camera systems) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document appears to be a routine administrative communication about equipment installation delays.

persons.name: Financial Program Specialist
persons.context: Author of the email, works for the United States Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY. They are communicating about the status of purchase orders for fiber cable and camera systems.

events.title: Email Regarding Procurement Status
events.description: A Financial Program Specialist sends an email regarding the status of purchase orders (ANIXTER TP120240 & SIGNET TECH TP120150) for fiber cable and camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The Comp. Tech advised that they cannot proceed with the Camera Systems due to not receiving the Fiber Cable, and the supplying company requires some documentation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated April 1, 2019, concerning procurement at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The email discusses delays in installing camera systems due to the non-receipt of fiber cable related to specific purchase orders (ANIXTER TP120240 & SIGNET TECH TP120150).
The sender is a Financial Program Specialist for the U.S. Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The document appears to be routine administrative correspondence and does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or related individuals.
The document identifier is EFTA00125311, which is part of a larger Epstein-related document release.
